article.headline: Villanova 74, Columbia 66
article.story: PHILADELPHIA (AP) -- Randy Foye had 20 points and Allan Ray added 19 to lift Villanova to a 74-66 win over Columbia on Monday. Villanova -- playing its first game with a full roster -- got 16 points and nine rebounds from Curtis Sumpter, while Mike Nardi added 14 points. The Wildcats (7-2) also had a season-high nine steals in winning their fourth straight. Dragutin Kravic led Columbia (2-5) with 17 points. Matt Preston added 13. Foye hit a free throw early in the second half that snapped a 35-35 tie and started a 13-3 run. Columbia pulled within four with 7:34 to play, but Sumpter slammed home a pass from Nardi then hit a pair of free throws to extend the lead to eight. The teams traded baskets for the next 5:02 until the Wildcats hit four free throws in the final minute to secure the win. Derrick Snowden and Marcus Austin were the last of five Wildcats to complete suspensions stemming from a March incident involving improper use of a university telephone access code. Both players dressed for Monday's game, but neither saw action. Lions' coach Joe Jones received a standing ovation from the crowd during pregame introductions. Jones spent the last six seasons as a Villanova assistant before being hired by Columbia in April. The Lions held a 5-point lead with 7:46 left in the first half before Villanova went on a 9-0 run. Sumpter hit a turnaround jumper in the final minute to keep the lead at four, but MacQuarrie hit a 3-pointer to trim the halftime margin to one.
